title: Lawmakers Suggest Follow-Up Boat Strike Could Be a War Crime
summary: Top Republicans have joined Democrats in demanding answers about the escalating military campaign the Trump administration says is aimed at targeting drug traffickers.

title: Rubio Says ‘Much Work’ to Be Done After Talks With Ukrainian Officials
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and other U.S. officials met with a Ukrainian delegation that was without Andriy Yermak, who resigned as chief of staff to Ukraine’s president on Friday.

title: How Trump’s Actions Could Affect Honduran Elections
summary: President Trump weighed in heavily on Honduras’s elections. Will voters be influenced on Sunday by his pardon of an ex-president or his pick in this year’s race?

title: The Ex-President Whom Trump Plans to Pardon Flooded America With Cocaine
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández, whom Mr. Trump called a victim of persecution, helped orchestrate a decades-long trafficking conspiracy. It ravaged his Central American country.

title: College Student Is Deported During Trip Home for Thanksgiving
summary: Any Lucia López Belloza, 19, was detained by immigration agents at the Boston airport before a flight to surprise her family in Texas for Thanksgiving. She is now in Honduras.

title: Remembering WW2 Camps, Japanese Americans Fight Trump’s Immigration Crackdown
summary: Japanese Americans are seeing parallels between the government’s incarceration of their families during World War II and the current detention of Latinos.

title: Silicon Valley’s Man in the White House Is Benefiting Himself and His Friends
summary: David Sacks, the Trump administration’s A.I. and crypto czar, has helped formulate policies that aid his Silicon Valley friends and many of his own tech investments.

title: Two Retail Chiefs Take Stock of a Make-or-Break Holiday Shopping Season
summary: The leaders of Nordstrom and Selfridges are dealing with tariffs, a tough economy and a fight for relevance.

title: The Political Price Shock of Data Centers and Electric Bills
summary: Democrats zeroed in on utilities and affordability to win Republican support in upset elections in Georgia and Virginia. Can the same playbook work in 2026?

title: Netanyahu Asks Israel’s President to Pardon Him in Corruption Cases
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the contentious appeal weeks after President Trump had made the same request to the Israeli president.

title: The Netanyahu Corruption Trial, Explained
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked Israel’s president to pardon him preemptively, before any verdicts were reached in his corruption cases. Here’s what to know about his trial.

title: Pope Leo Calls for a Two-State Solution in Mideast Conflict
summary: The pope, arriving in Lebanon, also encouraged that country’s Christians to stay where they are, despite economic, political and security concerns.

title: The Language of Tom Stoppard, Ablaze With Energy and Urgency
summary: In works like “Travesties” and “Arcadia,” the playwright embraced the really big questions and wrestled words into coherent, exhilarating shape.

title: Stream Movies Written by Tom Stoppard: ‘Shakespeare In Love’ and More
summary: Spinning off Shakespeare, waltzing through Imperial Russia, bantering about literature or diving deeply into history, Stoppard shared his gifts on the screen.

title: Tom Stoppard Wrote Dialogue for Indiana Jones and Obi-Wan Kenobi
summary: The playwright won an Academy Award for “Shakespeare in Love.” But he was also a prolific script doctor who worked with filmmakers like Steven Spielberg.

title: Having a Cellphone at Younger Than 12 Could Carry Health Risks, Study Says
summary: Researchers found higher rates of depression, poor sleep and obesity among tweens who had early access to a cellphone.

title: America’s Backyard Isn’t as Quiet as It Looks
summary: Latin Americans have proved surprisingly acquiescent to U.S. aggression — but that won’t last forever.

title: Forget Therapy. I’m Turning to Magic.
summary: Instead of going to therapy for $100 a week, I began to invest in an astrological session every few months.

title: 4 Dead, Including 3 Children, After Shooting at Birthday Party in California
summary: The shooting in Stockton, a city in California’s Central Valley, left 11 others wounded. The authorities said they were looking for a suspect.

title: Storm Threatens to Bring ‘Widespread and Impactful’ Snow and Ice to Northeast
summary: A potential nor’easter could leave as much as a foot of snow in the Poconos in Pennsylvania, the Catskills in New York, and parts of Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Vermont, a forecaster said.

title: Hong Kong’s Migrant Domestic Workers Mourn Their Losses in Deadly Fire
summary: At least eight workers died, and many of those who survived, after saving children and others in their care, are worried about losing their jobs and being forced to leave.

title: Cory Booker Weds Alexis Lewis in a Private Ceremony
summary: The couple married at a courthouse in Newark days before hosting an intimate wedding in Washington, D.C. on Saturday. They shared their wedding details exclusively with The New York Times.
